problems.title: Matrix Multiplication
problems.description:
Write a program to multiply two N x N matrices A and B.

Input Format:
- First line contains an integer N.
- Next N lines contain N integers each, representing Matrix A.
- Next N lines contain N integers each, representing Matrix B.

Output Format:
Print the resulting N x N matrix. Each row should be on a new line, with elements separated by a space.
hintsList: Use three nested loops: i for rows of A, j for columns of B, and k for the common dimension.
Result[i][j] = sum(A[i][k] * B[k][j]) for k from 0 to N-1.

problems.title: Pythagorean Triplets Count
problems.description:
Write a program to count the number of Pythagorean triplets (a, b, c) such that a^2 + b^2 = c^2 and 1 <= a < b < c <= N.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count of triplets.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
10

Sample Output:
2

Explanation:
The triplets are (3, 4, 5) and (6, 8, 10).
hintsList: Use three nested loops for a, b, and c.
Ensure a < b < c and check if a*a + b*b == c*c.

problems.title: Triplets with Given Sum
problems.description:
Given an integer N and a sum S, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i, j, k <= N and i + j + k = S.

Input Format:
Two integers N and S separated by a space.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count of triplets.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
5 10

Sample Output:
15

Explanation:
Some triplets are (1, 4, 5), (2, 3, 5), (3, 3, 4), etc.
hintsList: Use three nested loops, each from 1 to N.
Check if the sum of loop variables equals S.

problems.title: 3D Block Pattern
problems.description:
Write a program to print N blocks of N x N squares. Each block k (from 1 to N) should be filled with the number k.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print N blocks. Each block is an N x N grid. Separate blocks with a blank line.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
2

Sample Output:
1 1
1 1

2 2
2 2

Explanation:
Two blocks of 2x2 squares are printed. First block contains 1s, second contains 2s.
hintsList: Use three nested loops: outer for block number, middle for rows, inner for columns.
Print a blank line between blocks.

problems.title: Sum of Triple Nested Series
problems.description:
Calculate the sum of the series: sum_{i=1}^N sum_{j=1}^i sum_{k=1}^j k.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the total sum.
hintsList: Use three nested loops with limits as specified in the summation.
Accumulate the value of k in a sum variable.

problems.title: Triplets with Even Sum
problems.description:
Count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i < j < k <= N and (i + j + k) is an even number.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
5

Sample Output:
6

Explanation:
The triplets are (1, 2, 3), (1, 2, 5), (1, 3, 4), (1, 4, 5), (2, 3, 5), (3, 4, 5). Sums are 6, 8, 8, 10, 10, 12 respectively.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k with i < j < k.
Check if (i + j + k) % 2 == 0.

problems.title: Layered Number Square
problems.description:
Print N layers of squares. Layer L (from 1 to N) should be an L x L square filled with the number L.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print N layers. Each layer L is an L x L grid. Separate layers with a blank line.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
3

Sample Output:
1

2 2
2 2

3 3 3
3 3 3
3 3 3

Explanation:
Layer 1 is 1x1, Layer 2 is 2x2, Layer 3 is 3x3.
hintsList: Use three nested loops: outer for layer L, middle for rows (1 to L), inner for columns (1 to L).
Print a blank line between layers.

problems.title: Triplets with Given Product
problems.description:
Given an integer N and a product P, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i, j, k <= N and i * j * k = P.

Input Format:
Two integers N and P separated by a space.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops from 1 to N.
Check if i * j * k == P.

problems.title: 3D Coordinate Sum
problems.description:
Given three integers X, Y, and Z, calculate the sum of (i + j + k) for all 0 <= i <= X, 0 <= j <= Y, and 0 <= k <= Z.

Input Format:
Three integers X, Y, and Z separated by spaces.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the total sum.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k.
Accumulate (i + j + k) in a sum variable.

problems.title: Unique Triplets Lexicographical
problems.description:
Given an integer N, print all unique triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i < j < k <= N in lexicographical order.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print each triplet on a new line, with elements separated by a space.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
4

Sample Output:
1 2 3
1 2 4
1 3 4
2 3 4

Explanation:
All unique triplets with elements from 1 to 4 are printed in order.
hintsList: Use three nested loops: i from 1 to N, j from i+1 to N, k from j+1 to N.
Print i, j, and k separated by spaces.

problems.title: Triplets with Prime Sum
problems.description:
Given an integer N, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i < j < k <= N and (i + j + k) is a prime number.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k with i < j < k.
Write a helper function to check if a number is prime.

problems.title: Divisible Triplets
problems.description:
Given an integer N, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i, j, k <= N and (i + j) is divisible by k.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops from 1 to N.
Check if (i + j) % k == 0.

problems.title: Sum of Products Series
problems.description:
Calculate the sum of the series: sum_{i=1}^N sum_{j=1}^i sum_{k=1}^j (i * j * k).

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the total sum.
hintsList: Use three nested loops with limits as specified in the summation.
Accumulate the product (i * j * k) in a sum variable.

problems.title: Coprime Triplets
problems.description:
Given an integer N, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i < j < k <= N and the Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of i, j, and k is 1.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
4

Sample Output:
3

Explanation:
Triplets (i, j, k) with i < j < k:
(1, 2, 3) -> gcd(1, 2, 3) = 1
(1, 2, 4) -> gcd(1, 2, 4) = 1
(1, 3, 4) -> gcd(1, 3, 4) = 1
(2, 3, 4) -> gcd(2, 3, 4) = 1
Wait, gcd(2, 3, 4) is 1. So all 4 triplets have gcd 1.
Actually, let's re-check N=4:
(1,2,3) gcd=1
(1,2,4) gcd=1
(1,3,4) gcd=1
(2,3,4) gcd=1
Total = 4.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k with i < j < k.
Write a helper function to calculate the GCD of two numbers.

problems.title: XOR Triplets
problems.description:
Given two integers N and X, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i, j, k <= N and the bitwise XOR of i, j, and k is equal to X.

Input Format:
Two integers N and X separated by a space.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops from 1 to N.
Use the bitwise XOR operator ^ to check the condition.

problems.title: Perfect Square Triplet Sum
problems.description:
Given an integer N, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i <= j <= k <= N and (i^2 + j^2 + k^2) is a perfect square.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k with i <= j <= k.
Check if the sum of squares is a perfect square using sqrt function.

problems.title: Matrix Sub-rectangle Sum Count
problems.description:
Given an N x N matrix of integers and a target sum S, count the number of sub-rectangles whose elements sum up to S.

Input Format:
First line contains two integers N and S.
Next N lines contain N integers each representing the matrix.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
problems.examples:
Sample Input:
2 3
1 2
2 1

Sample Output:
4

Explanation:
Sub-rectangles with sum 3:
(0,0) to (0,1) -> 1+2=3
(0,0) to (1,0) -> 1+2=3
(0,1) to (1,1) -> 2+1=3
(1,0) to (1,1) -> 2+1=3
Total = 4.
hintsList: A sub-rectangle is defined by its top-left (r1, c1) and bottom-right (r2, c2) corners.
Use four nested loops to select the corners and two more to calculate the sum (or optimize with prefix sums).

problems.title: Pairwise Coprime Triplets
problems.description:
Given an integer N, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i < j < k <= N and each pair in the triplet is coprime (i.e., gcd(i, j) = 1, gcd(j, k) = 1, and gcd(i, k) = 1).

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops for i, j, and k with i < j < k.
Check gcd(i, j), gcd(j, k), and gcd(i, k) for each triplet.

problems.title: Sum of All Sub-matrix Sums
problems.description:
Given an N x N matrix, calculate the sum of the sums of all possible sub-matrices.

Input Format:
First line contains an integer N.
Next N lines contain N integers each representing the matrix.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the total sum.
hintsList: Use six nested loops to iterate through all sub-matrices and their elements.
Alternatively, consider how many sub-matrices each element matrix[i][j] belongs to.

problems.title: XOR and Sum Relation Triplets
problems.description:
Given two integers N and X, count the number of triplets (i, j, k) such that 1 <= i, j, k <= N and (i ^ j ^ k) = (i + j + k - X).

Input Format:
Two integers N and X separated by a space.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count.
hintsList: Use three nested loops from 1 to N.
Check the condition (i ^ j ^ k) == (i + j + k - x).
